entry.title: bitcoin.org missing bitcoin core version 22.0
entry.summary:
The email from ZmnSCPxj to Yanmaani opens with a playful acknowledgment of the time zone difference, suggesting a level of familiarity and camaraderie between the two. ZmnSCPxj then delves into a discussion about identity and anonymity within the context of Bitcoin. They argue that what might start as an anonymous label, such as "ZmnSCPxj," can evolve into a recognized identity within the community. This evolution underscores the blend of personal and anonymous contributions that characterize participation in Bitcoin's ecosystem.
Furthermore, ZmnSCPxj touches on an important aspect of human resourcefulness and its implications for Bitcoin. They emphasize that intelligence and capability are not confined to specific geographies or conditions. Individuals from challenging backgrounds, who have honed their skills and intellect through adversity, are highlighted as valuable potential contributors to Bitcoin. The underlying message is one of inclusivity and the strategic importance of welcoming diverse talents to contribute to Bitcoin's success.
ZmnSCPxj warns against overlooking or alienating these smart individuals, as doing so could lead them to become adversaries of Bitcoin. The point here is twofold: recognizing the universal distribution of talent and the necessity of integrating such talents into the Bitcoin community to foster its growth and resilience. This perspective invites reflection on how communities, especially those centered around technology and innovation, can benefit from embracing varied backgrounds and experiences.
